review:
Weird, is the one word i would use to sum up this one.  It's not much of a puzzle, more of a very strange yet compelling story.  There are some weird twists and turns as you learn about the main characters past. It is very hard to describe with out giving anything away.

If you wanna take a chance on a short little game you can play in an evening, i'd suggest this one for sure. The story might just leave you questioning things about the events that happen and your perspective. 

Voice acting and music were good. Over all the story was well written and smooth leaving you wanting a bit more. A nice way to spend an evening for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032373667', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1580094669}
review:
[h1]A sweet way to pass the time for point-and-click genre fans, but as deliciously unfulfilling as sugary cereal.[/h1]

[i]Charnel House Trilogy[/i] opens to a title screen with a picture of three stacked books lit by soft lantern light while haunting classical-esque piano music plays. Any one of the three books can be clicked on to step into that part of the tale. Fans of recent years’ point-and-click releases can anticipate sinking into the comforting familiarity of the handiwork and voicework of genre names such as Abe Goldfarb, Ben Chandler, Ivan Ulyanov, and more.

[h1]The Titles - "What’s in a name?"[/h1]
The game is broken into three ‘books’: [i]Inhale[/i], [i]Sepulchre[/i], and [i]Exhale[/i]. I’m assuming this is why the word ‘trilogy’ was included in the game’s title, although to me the short length makes calling it a trilogy a bit of a misnomer. Also, from a theming standpoint, it would have been more clever to give [i]Sepulchre[/i] a breathing-related title.

[h1]The Characters[/h1]
The main character for [i]Inhale[/i] and [i]Exhale[/i] is Alex Davenport. Since the player spends a lot more game time with Alex, it’s not surprising that you learn more about her. She’s a gamer and a reader going through a recent breakup. The main character for [i]Sepulchre[/i] is Harold Lang. He’s a professor of archaeology and a museum curator. It’s hard to get as much of a sense of his character since the player doesn’t spend as much time with him. Alex and Harold only have a brief interaction in game, although they are somehow mutually connected by Kat, Alex’s friend and Harold’s field assistant. Both of them are travelling to meet her. There’s also a cast of supporting characters such as Don (the train conductor), Rob (Alex’s neighbor), and Lydia (a little girl who is also on the train). Considering how quickly the game moves, it’s a testament to the game’s design that you learn as much about the characters as you do in such a short amount of time.

[h1]The Story - Build Up To Nothing[/h1]
[i]Charnel House Trilogy[/i] tries to explore lots of themes: archaeology, earth, death, worms. However, I don’t even think that you can call the game anticlimactic because it never builds up enough excitement to be a disappointing letdown. If it does build up anything, it’s loose ends. For example, what is the use of the green balloon? Was that meant to be used in the alternate endings that didn’t come to fruition? As it is, the single ending lacks closure and seems to imply that it isn’t the correct ending since multiple characters literally say it wasn’t supposed to happen this way.

The credits end with the statement, “Augur Peak will rise 2016.” Considering it’s now 2020, the developer website has many dead links, and I couldn’t find any whisper of news about the sequel, its imminent arrival does not seem promising. If it ever does get released, I will totally play it, but as it is, the fact that [i]Charnel House Trilogy[/i] spends so much time building up for a non-existent sequel weakens the game.

[h1]Art and Mechanics - Familiarity Breeds Contempt?[/h1]
The game has fairly standard retro pixel art and point-and-click mechanics for the genre. From what I saw, the game developers don’t seem to have tried anything innovative in terms of gameplay or anything interesting in terms of color theory, etc. The best that can be said for the puzzles is that they make sense in the story’s context. For example, the character had a good reason for needing to find something to trigger the memory of a forgotten password. The game even attempts to poke fun at the tendency of this genre to create overly elaborate solutions for puzzles. However, the joke falls short since there aren’t really any puzzles that you have to mentally wrestle to solve. Sometimes the next step is outright told to the player character, and even when it isn’t, there’s a miniscule set of options to try. Maybe to an inexperienced point-and-click player the puzzles would be more challenging.

[h1]Achievements[/h1]
It’s always a plus when there are missable achievements because it does add some replay value. In this case, however, even the achievements lack a certain verve.

[h1]Content to Price Ratio[/h1]
At $5.99 USD and 2 hours playtime, [i]Charnel House Trilogy[/i] technically meets my movie ticket rule of having enough content to be the length of a movie for a movie ticket price. That said, compared to other similarly priced games in the genre that offer more complete story arcs and more challenging puzzles to solve, it may be better to wait for a sale.

[h1]In Conclusion[/h1]
Despite the delightful presence and involvement of point-and-click genre greats, [i]Charnel House Trilogy[/i] suffers from being overly familiar, lacking innovation, and being a set-up to, at the moment, nothing. That said, it’s a worthwhile game to scratch the point-and-click itch if picked up on sale. Happy gaming!

author: {'steamid': '76561198201096703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1641164803}
review:
Öncelikle 15 tl fiyat 2 saatte bitirebileceğiniz bu oyun için fazla. Ama %90 indirimle 1,5 tl gibi bir fiyata aldığınız zaman, ders arasında atıştırılan bir bisküvi/ kek gibi düşünerek oynarsanız pişman olmazsınız.

Ben de oyunu final haftam başlamadan önce biraz kafa dağıtmak için oynadım, kesinlikle de zaman ayırdığıma değdiğini düşünüyorum. Şimdi incelemeye geçelim...

The Charnel House Trilogy, 3 adet minik bölümden oluşan, pixel art kullanılarak yapılmış bir point & click adventure oyunu. Charnel House'ın anlamına bakarsanız zaten oyun hakkında genel bir fikir edinebilirsiniz. Menü ekranını açtığınızda gördüğünüz bölümlerin isimleri sırasıyla "Inhale", "Sepulchre" ve "Exhale". Yine buradan da nefes, kabir/ defnetmek vb. "ölüm" ile ilgili anlamlar çıkarmak mümkün. 

Başlangıçta dairesinde yalnız yaşayan, sıradan bir kızla ilgili bilgiler edinmemizi sağlayan oyunda, ilerledikçe bir yolculuğun, -creepy bir yolculuğun- bu kızın hayatındaki bilinmeyenleri açığa çıkarttığını görüyoruz. Ailesi, arkadaşları, eski sevgilisi, stalker'ı, trene binmeden önce lafladığı adam... gibi her gördüğümüz kişi bazı sırların çözülmesinde puzzle parçası görevi görüyor. Bol miktarda sembolizm var, fikir vermesi için sadece en göze çarpanını yazacağım [spoiler]after life yolculuğu diye tanımlayabileceğim bu tren yolculuğunda, insanların solucanlı toprakla dolu "bavullara" dönüşmesi bana wtf dedirtti[/spoiler]. Ayrıca kime güvenip kime güvenilmeyeceği konusunda, insan ilişkileri ve "manipülasyon" konusunda sorgulama yaptırmayı başarabiliyor. Boyutuna göre oldukça ağır konulara değindiği için takdirimi kazandığını söylemeliyim. Daha örnekler vererek yaptırdığı çağrışımları vb. anlatırdım da o zaman bu yazı inceleme olmaktan çıkardı ve ben spoiler vermek istemiyorum, hoşunuza giderse alıp kendiniz keşfedin daha iyi.

Ucu devam ettirilmeye müsait bir şekilde açık bırakıldığı için ve oynarken size anlattığı şeylerin yanında anlatmadığı şeyler de bulunduğu için, üzerinde düşünüp teoriler kurmaya müsait bir oyun. Bu yönünü sevdim, yani şöyle diyeyim, herkes iyi yapamıyor bunu. Bazı yapımcılar konuları olduğu gibi bir yere bağlamadan bırakıyorlar ve tatmin olmuyorsunuz. Ama bu oyunda öyle değildi. Tabii daha detaylandırılmasını istediğim noktalar yok değil, ama gene de genel olarak hikaye doyurucu ve keyif vericiydi.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1951455393
Oyunun barındırdığı korku ve gerilim öğeleri (hayalet ya da şimşeklerin çakması gibi), atmosfere uygun müziklerle birleştiğinde anlatılan hikayeye kapılmak oldukça kolaylaşıyor. Ben o korku ögelerine rağmen kendimi güzel bir kitabın içinde kaybolmuşum gibi huzurlu hissettim, oyunun akışı ve gidişatı sıkmadı hiç. 

Seslendirmelerin bazısı gayet iyi ama bazıları başarısız, neyse ki başarısız olanlar az ve fazla kopma yaşamadan devam edebiliyoruz. 

Soundtrack kısmı gerçekten başarılıydı, oyun sonunda Credits ekranında durdurup durdurup aradım ama bulamadım müzikleri. Sonra oyun ismi + ost diye aratmak aklıma geldi ve EVREKAAA öyle bir video varmış, çok mutluyum :D Sizinle de paylaşmak istiyorum bu güzel müzikleri:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6kylQ94faXA

Bulmacaları kafa yorucu değil, genelde bulduğumuz şeyi nerede kullanacağımız gayet belirgin oluyor ya da doğrudan oyun bize hangi nesneyle ne yapacağımızı söylüyor. Daha zorlayıcı olabilirdi, ama hikayeden kopmamak adına ve sembolizm üzerine düşünebilelim diye böyle tercih edilmiş olabilir, o nedenle normal buluyorum.

Gerçekten eksi olarak yazabileceğim tek şey, oyun çok hoş ama o kadar kısa ki tadı damağınızda kalıyor. Birkaç bölüm daha uzun olsa veya bir devam oyunu olsa, daha iyi olurmuş.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014473461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1576090975}
review:
It's not awful, but the overall rating is a little more shiny than is deserved. I wish there were a "neutral" or "mixed" review option, or a less aggressive but still slightly negative option.

[h1]"Trilogy"[/h1]
[list]I found ~1.5h of total playtime here across all 3 titles. That's pretty weak. None of the 3 on its own is worth >$0.99 (USD), so I'm not sure how we do the math to arrive at $3.99 for all 3. Glad I got them on sale.[/list]
[h1]"Point-and-click"[/h1]
[list]You do indeed point and click to do stuff, but that's about as far as it goes. Items and plot-devices are not especially hidden, "puzzles" are not at all challenging. Everything is extremely linear: 90% of the time you just do what you're literally told, or make an obvious choice to use one of the few items you have available in the one place where you clearly need to use an item. In CH2 and CH3 you spend a little while wandering between 6 (nearly identical) rooms, but even that is quite linear, as you can typically only enter one of them at any given moment.[/list]
[h1]"Horror"[/h1]
[list][*][b][u]CH1[/u][/b]: Some vaguely foreboding and somewhat fantastical plot-points show up, but many don't seem to foreshadow anything that happens later. The characters here re-appear in Ch3, but are largely absent from Ch2.
[*][b][u]CH2[/u][/b]: This is more decidedly and fantastically creepy and surreal -- probably the most atmospheric chapter, and arguably does the most to build the world. There's a lot that seems symbolic of a larger narrative. Is it going somewhere?
[*][b][u]CH3[/u][/b]: Apparently not. Despite the shared setting with Ch2,  this feels like a very different world, and what's creepy is mostly just a human creep, not anything fantastic. Some surreal stuff shows up again, but it all feels pretty disjointed. It's like they couldn't figure out what the focus was supposed to be or how the horror elements should be integrated. There's just a scattershot attempt to make everything horrific in some manner or other.[/list]
[h1]"Mystery"[/h1] 
[list]You won't really be solving any mysteries [i]in-game[/i], as a matter of gameplay. The only relevant mysteries are "what even happened in this game?" and "did I get much of anything out of playing it?" [/list]
On sale, it's fine. If you know and care who the people are who participated in it (as listed in the game description), then maybe it gains some points as a piece of gamer culture, but gameplay itself just wasn't very compelling to me.

review:
I would say of that game that it looks more like an introduction of a whole series rather than a complete game. Still, we get to have 3 chapters, the 2nd one having being written first, but which fits nicely in between then two others.
The story is dark and a little creepy but I wouldn't tag it as gore or horror. There is no jump scare or anything of that sort, so if you were hesitating because of that, well go forward, you'll be good.
While I have 10 hours of play, it only took 2 hours to finish the whole game, I'm only easily distracted and I played a second time for a friend who was curious about the game. Let's say it's a good introduction to the universe and I'm curious of what will happen next.

author: {'steamid': '76561198402214760', 'num_games_owned': 1457, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1572711801}
review:
This Point and Click lite game is more about the story then combining objects together to advance through the story.  It is a fairly short, easy to 100% game.  I got it for less than a dollar and given the playtime its pretty decent value for money.  If you enjoyed The Cat Lady and The Lion's Song then this will most likely do you right.

_____________________

PROS

+  story elements.  The story is a bit cliche and you will know what is going on from the very start but the little parts that all fit together to make the story complete are great and it gives a satisfactory ending to to the game.

+   no pixel hunting.  This is not a traditional point and click in the sense that finding stuff that you need is very easy and there are only a couple of times you actually need mess around with your inventory to get the items you need.  

+ voices in my head.  The voice acting is fairly solid.  The writing isn't always great though.  I strangely sound very much like the conductor on the train which was a bit weird.  I have found my voice twin.

______________________

CONS

-  2 of the cheevos didn't trigger for me.  

-  closure.  I would have liked a bit more closure or at least a bit more of a solid idea on what the story was.  

_________________________

This game is a short little point and clicker with pixelart that is honestly top-notch.  I spent 70 cents on this game and it was well worth the price.

[h1] ▀▄▀▄▀▄ The Charnel House Trilogy ▄▀▄▀▄▀ [/h1]

The Charnel House Trilogy is horror point & click adventure game with a decent run time and pretty good voice acting all around. You'll swap between a couple of characters as they've boarded the train to Augur Peak and pieces of the story are revealed to you. I don't want to say much about the story, this is best experienced going in blind. However, it does setup for a sequel that has yet to surface from the developers so that may or may never happen. I also wish there was more of an equal focus on both characters but I suspect it's saved for this possible sequel.

I would say The Charnel House Trilogy is worth playing despite some of the minor issues here, this does have some dark subject matter so know that going in. Considering the sequel is in limbo, maybe pick this up on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043250032', 'num_games_owned': 2464, 'num_reviews': 329, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1574792456}
review:
[h1]Decent gothic horror with an unwelcome dose of Jim Sterling[/h1]

The Charnel House Trilogy is a gothic point & click game developed by Owl Cave. You play as Alex and Dr Harold Lang over the course of three chapters. Both of these characters are brought together on a train journey to the mysterious Augur Island, and over the course of the three chapters the sinister nature of Augur Island comes to light. 

[h1]Positives: [/h1]
[list][*]The visuals look fairly dated for a game that came out in 2015, but the art is well designed and when combined with the excellent ambient audio, it helps create the game’s creepy atmosphere.

[*]The voice acting for the three main characters (Alex, Lang & Don) are fairly good. The audio quality is a bit rough, but the performances themselves are convincing. I particularly liked Don, but it’s just because I’m a sucker for a Scottish accent. Floyd is also fairly well acted, he’s just not a main character. 

[*]Each chapter sort of has its own contained story, but their main purpose is to contribute to the overall story of the game. I won’t give details to avoid spoiling anything, but I will say that I thought the overall story was compelling. Each chapter doesn’t really work by itself but as long as you view it as one ‘larger’ story that doesn’t matter.

[*]The writing is good, the characters and the overall plot are believable within the game world. 

[*]The gothic elements of the game are well done, this definitely feels like gothic fiction once you get a bit further into it. 

[*]They kept things short, so the game doesn't overstay its welcome. It's just a shame that they never got around to making the sequel as the game ends with a set up for another story.

[*]It’s pretty easy to get all the achievements. [/list]

[h1]Neutral: [/h1]
[list][*]The puzzles are all fairly straightforward. Personally, I prefer simpler puzzles as I’m only interested in the story from point & click games, but I imagine more seasoned point & click players might be disappointed that it’s so easy. 

[*]Coming in at just two hours to complete, and all other things considered, $8 is pretty steep for it. It does get super cheap during sales though at which point it’s good value. [/list]

[h1]Negatives: [/h1]
[list][*]For reasons beyond my understanding, they got Jim Sterling to voice one of the characters. His voice ‘acting’ completely killed much of my enjoyment for the final episode, which is a shame because I thought the writing was good. Half the time he’s trying to put on a weird accent, the other half of the time he just sounds like himself and at absolutely no point is he doing anything close to acting. 

[*]As for the rest of the voice acting (excluding the characters I mentioned earlier) ranges from not great to abysmal. Some of this is due to poor audio quality (such as Carli) and some of it is down to bad acting (such as Isaiah). 

[*]You can’t pause during dialog, which is one of my pet peeves with most point & click games. 

[*]Alt-tabbing really messes the game up, so don’t bother with it. [/list]

[h1]Verdict: [/h1]

Jim Sterling’s voice acting is dreadful addition to the game, but all in all this is fairly enjoyable. The writing is believable, the main characters are well acted and it’s a healthy dose of gothic horror. It’s a tad expensive for what it is, but if you can grab it on sale then it’s worth the two hours it’ll take you to finish it. 

If you found this review helpful, please consider following my curator page: [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33633486/]Kemo's Corner.[/url]

review:
Well, this was a short little game! Nice point and click adventure game with a good narrative. The actors are hit and miss but it's probably friends and family doing the voices from home or something. It's not a big deal and it's nice to have voices in the first place for a small release like this.

There's supposed to be a sequel to this and it would have been nice because while it doesn't overstay its welcome, you're left wanting more which is a good thing! Doesn't look like the sequel will happen. The dev's page hasn't been updated since 2015.

If you're feeling like a point and click but don't also feel like doing insane puzzles that don't make sense or be stuck for hours, The Charler House Trilogy will give you the perfect fix with an interesting story too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043179243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1568478453}
review:
Основной и главный недостаток игры - её длительность. На мой взгляд, история оказалась недосказанной,  а третья глава открыла слишком много информации разом. Вторая часть, которая была анонсирована, вероятно, не появится, и жаль.
Из плюсов:
+ Мне понравилась тема с поездом, потому что лично для меня путешествие на поезде всегда повод для некоторого переосмысления, игра хорошо легла на мой личный опыт.
+ Атмосфера жути не перебарщивала. Её было ровно столько, чтобы было не по себе, изящно. 
+/- Загадки были не невероятно сложными, но не такими простыми, чтобы просто накликать все предметы в комнате и сразу все решить. Чувство такого приятного легкого прохождения. Но, в целом могло бы быть и лучше, если бы игра была длиннее и масштабнее.  

В целом показалось, что создатели не совсем верно выдержали скорость игры, темп повествования стоило держать более медленным и угнетающим. Мне было бы интересно узнать больше обо всем происходящем (особенно мало мы узнали о втором герое), но, по крайней мере, им удалось вызвать у меня этот интерес. Надеюсь, мы еще увидим проекты от этих ребят.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169368632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1566783225}
review:
THis is stupid. THe whole plot is just a big yawn of self-induced importance. I don't even know what the significance of the end scene was .....nor do I care, it was so pointless and was so proud of itself for some reason. HOW CAN THE CREDITS BE SOOOOO LONG??!?!??! 
THe voice acting was okay. THe graphics are fine. The idea of the game is ....fine. Just soo many stupid things here, most of alll the plot itself.
And its sooo short. A Trilogy!?!?!??! a trilogy of demos is more like it.
First part is just 1 ROOOM, A SINGLE ROOM. Plus a 1/4 room. so its literally 1 1/4 rooms long.....SHORT.
Second part is just a train.....and its a bit longer...maybe twie as long as the first at most. and it made NO SENSE why that character even exists makes no sense to me....he's so pointless.
Third part IS THE SAME ENVIRONMENT AND LEVEL AS THE SECOND PARTTTT. Which honestly is fine....I'm all fine with retracing steps and stuff thats fine, but its like a little bi tlonger than the second part and its the same gameplay as the second part.\

And god is the gameplay annoyingin this....the puzzles are frustrating cause it doesnt give u clues and forces u to guess every possible combination. And it changes how u pickup items...i thought i had a knife in my inventory but had to go all the way back and see that u have to click through twooooo windows for some parts to get the item oh wowwww.

Bottom line: it's stupidly short; the idea of the story is FINE but the way its told here is just lackluster and boring; the doctor guy is a pointless character who has no point in being around.....u can skip chapter 2 and not miss anything of value the real story is of the girl. And seriously the ending plot line raises so many questions that the dialogue actually utters right to you making u question why they wouldnt fix the problems instead of admitting them. How the heck can a trilogy be this short....I was expecting something like shardlight. This game is a pale pale pale pale pale pale pale version of shardlight.....and shardlight came out decades ago. So if you want a point and click pixel adventure go buy shardlight...I don't know what this game is trying to do. It's soo full of itself....those credits oh my god....and the end image was suppposed to get my excited?!!?? for what!?!???!? the ending was supposed to get me exicted!??!?! hoW!?!?!? its some charcter we never seen before, im guesssin git was that friend she was suppposed to meet, but its not like she had any bearing on the plot and was only mentioned 2x briefly in nothing important.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025120182', 'num_games_owned': 1537, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1569396526}
review:
Starts subtle, ends surprisingly. I enjoyed the way the game built a dense atmosphere with only few elements/screens/persons. No world trip, no Indiana Jones action scenes; just you, a lamp, an inhaler, bags ... ;) 
It's short, yes (3 hours, maybe?), but after reading the other reviews I expected a lot less. Especially I expected a loose story. But for me, this was a round thing; at least, from an emotional side - and I don't like when stories end too open ended / when I'm left alone after an end! 
It started a bit with obscurely ordinary everyday's scenes, like Coen brothers movie, maybe; but fortunately (I don't like Coen brothers movies for their endings), it ended a lot more explaining. Almost everything from the beginning that you see is brought back later, explaining it, or at least re-instantiating it. This made the game a lot less "random" for me like many other adventure games are. It has horror elements in it, but no jump scares and alike. Unsettling through its obscurity. Though I never felt uncomfortable or in danger when playing the game. You can play slow pace. It's a slow game, actually.

+ Beautiful soundtrack if you can enjoy calm piano music!
+ Has rain and snow in it. 
+ Very natural (not overacted) protagonist(s)
- I thought it was written by a woman, because the main character was so natural to me. Was a bit disappointed when I found out through credits that the devs were all male. Sorry guys, no offense. Great game anyway! ;D

author: {'steamid': '76561198118153024', 'num_games_owned': 830, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1565470191}
review:
I like using the term "Game Sucks" as a joke. And while I would very much like to use that term here it would neither a joke nor a well explained review. The game itself started out promising as it had decent pixel graphics and a voice actress that while not a professional, obviously had a lot of training. The first chapter [b]Inhale[/b] played out well enough, it made sense and didn't have those Sierra style solutions. It was short but ended with a "shocking" point, one that only served the purpose of looking grotesque and shocking. I'm just gonna straight up tell you, the conductor talks to a raven and then snaps its neck. This is never explained or even important to the story other than shocking the player with how out of place it is. I can understand if it was to set the tone, but not 6 seconds later does another thing happen that sets the tone much better. The next two chapters are just flat out weird, I understood what everything meant there was no guessing what was going on; it did a decent enough job explaining what was going on. But it still wasn't that great, I would say that the level of writing is my level and I am not a good writer. The "twist" as it were was predictable to the point where I doubted they were even going to do it, a subversion as it were. But it wasn't and it was just creepy for the sake of being creepy. 
After beating the game in an 1:45 minutes I'd say it feels like they were planing a sequel to "tie up loose ends" as it seems some parts of the story are either open ended or just left open for no reason.
Also the gal mentions she lives in New York, she gets on a train and whisky costs five pounds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019456847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1513706012}
review:
[i]Чеховское ружьё  — принцип драматургии, согласно которому каждый элемент повествования должен быть необходим, а несущественные элементы должны быть удалены; в истории не должно появляться элементов, обманывающих ожидания аудитории тем, что никогда не играют роль в дальнейших событиях.[/i]

[h1]Чеховский поезд[/h1]

Пожалуй начну с небольшой истории знакомства с этой игрой. После прохождения Layers of Fear, я был озадачен, как эта игра стала популярной. Сюжет, единственно что представляло ценность, был не просто банален, он сразу рассказывал и свою концовку. Но там был неплохой дизайн уровней.
И тем выразительней получился контраст с The Charnel House Trilogy. Самая сильная сторона игры - сюжет. А сюжет силён персонажами. Они герои этой игры-пьесы. Ведь если нет на сцене героев, повествование не сдвинется дальше под действием событий мира или места, они субъективны. Неторопливо игра по кусочку создаёт грандиозный финал, который получит далеко не каждый ААА-продукт. 
История начиналась банальна. Я уже смирился с монологами героини о человеке, которого, как я думал, не увижу, встречами и диалогами с персонажами, которых, я думал, после этого не увижу - так как покидаем это место. Но сюжет удивил, в конце поразил дуплетом из чеховского ружья, что висело на стене. Видите ли какой дело, аннотация к обзору не  совсем банальна - в сюжете нет лишнего. Нет лишнего и в персонажах и в их диалогах. Игра хорошо скомпонована, она коротка и в этом её прелесть. 
По мимо сюжета у игры нет сильных сторон. Ни шатко ни валко сделана квестовая часть игры, но не она здесь во главе угла. Много про неё говорить не хочется, если охарактеризовать одним словом - не мешается (на удивление). Графика посредственна, если не сказать хуже. Своего собственного стиля игра не имеет. Музыка на уровне, чтобы соответствовать выбранной темы лора игры, не более. 

Вывод: сюжет набирает обороты медленно, но в этом его соль. Если вы дадите шанс, возможно он и вас сможет в конце затронуть. Цена не сильно кусается, на распродажах со скидкой иногда стоит копейки, можно взять на сдачу от крупных проектов (возможно которые покажут себя хуже неё). Есть отличный русификатор, если не знаете английского языка.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012265668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1452428456}
review: The Charnel House Trilogy to gra przygodowa "point and click",  w której wcielamy się w dwójkę bohaterów - młodą kobietę o imieniu Alex oraz doktora Harolda Lang'a. Protagoniści wyruszają w podróż do Augur Peak pociągiem, który śmiało może otrzymać miano "pociągu widmo". Jednak, by wiele nie zdradzić, dodam jedynie, iż podczas tej podróży ma miejsce wiele paranormalnych wydarzeń, przez co produkcja jest bardziej horrorem niż thrillerem. Posiada ona niezwykle osobliwą atmosferę. Przez cały czas masz wrażenie, że ktoś cię obserwuje, co oczywiście nie jest minusem. Dodajmy do tego solidnie wykonaną (w większości) pracę aktorów głosowych i przecudownie napisaną muzykę, a zyskamy horror niemalże doskonały. Jedyne co może komuś przeszkadzać to grafika, choć osobiście uważam, że sama w sobie również dodaje nieco "niepokojącego" klimatu. Dzieło Owl Cave dzieli się na trzy rozdziały, z których najbardziej zapadł mi w pamięci drugi pt. Sepulchre - grób. Uwierzcie mi, gdy powiem, iż w tym rozdziale atmosferę można kroić nożem. Jeśli nie przekonuje was 81% (w momencie, gdy piszę tę recenzję) pozytywnych opinii oraz horrendalnie niska cena lub gatunek nie jest wam specjalnie bliski, to istnieje możliwość pobrania bezpłatnego dema. Rozgrywamy w nim własnie drugi rozdział trylogii - moim zdaniem najlepszy. Jeśli zaś jesteś maniakiem gier przygodowych "point and click", to jest to dla ciebie pozycja obowiązkowa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004894190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1559191492}
review: 3 hours. VERY short, but very good (mainly as an interactive story). There are no real "adventure game" puzzles or difficulty here. The dialogue points you directly to the next step. But it is a good short story worth enjoying. Reminded me somewhat of I Have No Mouth And I Must Scream. After finishing the game, however, I noticed a few achievements I did not get. Weird, I thought, since it was a very linear experience. It appears that maybe a few small choices matter here or there, and that there may be multiple endings, so I guess there is a replayability factor past the three hours it takes to move through the story. Recommended on sale because of the very short length. Well written story, and interesting ending. Endings?

author: {'steamid': '76561198111525150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1558881432}
review:
Cute stylised short point and click adventure. The game is separated into three chapters (hence the trilogy part) but its all the same overarching story. 

The game is very linear and there isn't much in the way of puzzles, but the story was enjoyable and creepy at the same time. However if you are a fan of horror, like me you will have seen this storyline before elsewhere.

The pixelated graphics aesthetic was a bold choice and a loving nod to classic point and click games of the 90's. This style will likely put some people off but is used in a really effective manner to create atmosphere and horror throughout the entire game.

I managed to speed through this game in 1.5 hours, but if you really wanted to soak up the story you would be looking at a play time of about 2-2.5 hours. There is minimal replay value, but sometimes it's good to be able to start and finish a game in a single day.

Overall rating would be a 5/10. Average but worth giving it a go especially if you want to see Jim Sterling playing Jim Sterling in a video game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985048152', 'num_games_owned': 1604, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1527550146}
review:
Это неоконченная история о загадочном поезде, который станет для героев игры воплощением их кошмаров. Один из них, Гарольд Лэнг, пытается о своём кошмаре забыть, но события, происходящие во время поездки, бередят старые раны. Другая, Алекс Дэвенпорт, до этого путешествия пребывала в беззаботном неведении, а теперь узнаёт нечто, переворачивающее всё её представление о привычной жизни.

The Charnel House Trilogy – это хоррор без скримеров. Он вызывает тревогу за счёт странных образов и добивает великолепной кульминацией, которая связывает все детали сюжета воедино и открывает ужасную тайну. Подобный подход к подаче страшной истории – большая редкость в этом игровом жанре.

Другие положительные стороны игры – приятный пиксель-арт и выразительные голоса, знакомые по AGS-квестам Wadjet Eye Games. По духу этот квест напоминает серию Blackwell.

Игра делится на три коротких эпизода, потому и называется трилогией (на самом деле по продолжительности она и на одну полноценную игру едва тянет). В первом и третьем эпизодах в качестве главной героини выступает Алекс, во втором – Гарольд. К сожалению, большая часть его истории осталась за кадром, можно только гадать, каковы были предпосылки к произошедшему и что означает весь этот символизм, который встретился ему в поезде. К счастью, историю Алекс рассказали полностью. Эта героиня слишком инфантильна, чтобы понравиться, но ей всё равно сопереживаешь.

Как квест эта игра чрезвычайно проста: ты заранее знаешь, что предстоит сделать, догадываешься о предметах, которые могут попасться на пути и пригодиться в определённой ситуации. Её можно пройти за пару часов, ни разу не заглянув в руководство, да что там – временами придётся осаживать себя, чтобы не проходить игру сломя голову и таким образом не развеять мистическую атмосферу.

Недостаток «Трилогии» в том, что она слишком короткая. И незавершённая. В конце игры пообещали продолжение, а на форумах есть старые сообщения о том, что работа над сиквелом ведётся. Ничего из этого, как мы понимаем, не гарантирует появления второй части.

Советую этот короткий и простой квест всем любителям благородных хорроров и незамысловатого геймплея.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066975058', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1473902615}
review:
Dá de chamar de jogo, mas parece muito mais um filme. Tanto pelo point-and-click, tanto pelo tempo que leva pra completar tudo.  Tem até o preço de uma entrada de cinema.

Contudo, isso não quer dizer que é um jogo ruim. Pelo contrário! É pouco mais de uma hora de diversão, mas é uma hora bem gasta. A narrativa é intrigante e bem desenvolvida. Os gráficos pixelados são muito bem feitos, e se encaixam perfeitamente no jogo em geral. É como uma sobremesa, curta e prazerosa.

Pra ser sincero, você pode achar alguns usos melhores pra 12 reais aqui na Steam, mas eu achei o jogo num pacote de keys aleatórias por cinco mangos. Esse foi o único jogo do pacote que eu gostei e, honestamente, valeu por todos os outros.

review: A really enjoyable short title. The stories are connected in a very interesting manner and they all sort of explain one another to some extend. Game keeps you guessing and as short as it may be it keeps the player attention through out. I should be cheap enough as 6$ to make up for it's short playtime but I'd say it is worth it. If anything play the demo. It is the 1/3 of the stories that are available.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048178872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1547788250}
review:
This was a great game. I feel one of the first things I should say though is that this title is somewhat misleading. When I think "trilogy" I think a long game, where as I'd say the "three games" in this one are just chapters in one single game. Don't let that deter you though this game is still excellent. The story is fast paced and intriguing. The characters are interesting and (most) of the voice acting is top notch. 

This is also one of the few games where I actually uttered the words "what the fuck" outloud. I really hope there is a sequel at some point because I have a lot of questions that I want answered. I might even pay full price for the sequel (I'm cheap and like games on sale lol).

author: {'steamid': '76561197993278872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1541360130}
review: A young lady named Alex encounters a strange night with odd phone calls and even odder nieghbors. She decides to take a train to get away and finds that the train is more than it seems. The Charnel House trilogy is  a short click adventure with an interesting storyline. Don't pay attention to my hours played (I often walk away from the computer leaving the game on), as it really is only a few hours to complete the entire game. As it only is a few hours worth and doesn't have much replay value it may not be worth the full amount versus a sale price, however, the storyline makes it worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106512564', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1540959030}
review:
This is a short but enjoyble point and click horror game.  Ending seems to imply that there was going to be a sequel but apparently nothing has come up in the last few years.  This 2hr jaunt is a good pick up if you can find it on sale.  Full price would be a bit much for what this game is, which is essentially a narrative horror set across three short acts.  

Pros-
-----------------------------------------
-Great voice acting for a short production.  Most recordings sound professional save for one of Alex's friends
-Beautiful backround art for a game of this style
-Creepy narative will suck you in if only for 2hrs
-Atmospheric Music


Cons
--------------------------------------------
-Short.  This game sets itself up for a great story but is unable to flesh it out in just these 3 acts.  End of game insinuates there was going to be a sequel but a quick internet search finds that there has been no movement on this as of 2018 and last mention of it was 2016.
-Puzzles mostly serve to drive the story forward and are not especially challenging


Overall a nice short game thats worth it if you can find it on steam sale.  The developers showed they are very capable of making a great point and click game, would love to see a sequel or other work in the future!

author: {'steamid': '76561198199045323', 'num_games_owned': 6320, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1447, 'last_played': 1537572046}
review:
I really enjoyed The Charnel House Trilogy, the story was quite interesting. The puzzles are not very difficult but they completed the story really well. The graphic remind me a lot of the Wadjet eye games, in fact if you love their games, you'll probably like this one as well. 

I would recommend it to anyone who love playing quirky story heavy Point & Click.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960397498', 'num_games_owned': 2453, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1539055283}

It has less puzzles and isn't as hard as Owl Cave's Rachard and Alice or Wadjet Eye games but has a similar style and a sort of Cat Lady/Downfall plot feel. Feels like one of those "make a game in 10 hours" challenge things that usually make no sense because they're not even supposed to be taken seriously.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001258363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1538846337}
review:
Although it promotes itself as three games in one, is a really short adventure game. The first two chapters are more introductions to the gist that happens in the third chapter, and this one isn't that complicated to beat through or even hunt for achievements.

However, despite very basic puzzles and some dubious mic quality between voice actors, is overall a solid story to enjoy. Is not groundbreaking and doesn't bring nothing new to both game and horror genres, but provides enough mistery in its few hours of gameplay. The game leaves in a bit of a cliffhanger, but still has a decent conclusion given how cryptid some plot points can be.

Given its low price and even lower in sales, is a decent narrative more than a game to enjoy. I was expecting more, but didn't disappoint anyways.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072182182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 352, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1537324148}
review:
One of the oddest and best horror stories ever told in a point 'n' click.  Gameplay is easy; emphasis is squarely on narrative.  And it's a narrative about an interdimensional death train in which the dreams, memories, and points of view of the dead (and mad) are mixed up like the bone salad of a charnel house.  The only real downside is that the story is not quite finished.  [i]Augur Peak[/i], the game's sequel, was supposed to come out in 2016 . . .

(I know indie creators have full-time jobs and lives and more important things to do besides amuse me, but c'mon . . . )

author: {'steamid': '76561197972442783', 'num_games_owned': 1249, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1535854235}
review: This game was pretty meh.  I just didn't care for it.  The voice acting/narration was dumb; over use of profanity (I have no problem with swearing, but this was just too much, felt like whiney emo dialogue).  The plus side is it's very short, under two hours to complete all three sections.  It did have a cool premise with going to a strange island, but it never actually comes, that would be next game/episode, however it does not appear there will be anymore.  There are much petter point-and-click pixelated games out there, this one's not worth the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140981863', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1533483447}
review:
I had this game in my library for a very long time, and, to be honest, I played it because I'm getting through my backlog alphabetically. But, oh boy, am I happy to have played it.

It is very short (around 2h) but the story just made those two hours very enjoyable.
It's not a difficult game and very intuitive(you don't tumble around to advance the story) The voice acting is really good, the story is open to interpretation and dark, it gave me uneasy vibes at a certain point. 

After the credit it shows that it's supposed to have a sequel, but so far, nothing. I hope it goes out soon, but the story is enjoyable without it. It does give a "ending" I was satisfied with.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999441214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1438051780}
review:
The Charnel House Trilogy is, sadly, a pretty short point-and-click adventure game. I didn't so much find it frightening, but it's got plenty of atmosphere.

It's gorgeously animated, from the early view out one protagonist's apartment window into a rain-drenched alley outside her apartment to the warm earthy colors of the inside of the train the bulk of the game takes place aboard. The music and writing are good.

It's a great game for the price, I just wish there were more of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134831159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1645061101}
review: Started out with a promising storyline but fell completely short later on in the game. It has no puzzles whatsoever. Its basically dialogue and interaction with everything. Really short.  I finished it in 2 hours. I wished I had bought it when it was on sale but unfortunately I missed the opportunity and found myself wasting $5 on it. Its not the worst game, but to be honest it failed to meet my expectations. If you wanna check it out I suggest getting it on sale. Not worth the $5. Also, Dr. Lang, the character you'll meet before boarding a train, doesnt have a worthy plotline. You could just as easily skip the Sepulchre (the middle part) and it still wont have any effect on Alex's story (the character you play as in The Charnel House Trilogy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015049156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1531244728}
review:
Alex ma telefon w kształcie kruka, złamane serce i długą noc przed sobą - o północy czeka ją stanie na mrozie w oczekiwaniu na pociąg. Podróż się dłuży, ani czytać, ani zapalić, zostaje jedynie wyprostowanie nóg przez kursowanie od konduktora do baru...

Przepraszam, czy tu STRASZĄ?
💀 gore: [spoiler]okazjonalna przemoc z ledwo widoczną krwią[/spoiler]
💀 jumpscares: [spoiler]BRAK [/spoiler]
💀 walka/chowanie się: [spoiler]BRAK[/spoiler]
💀 triggers: [spoiler]opis tortur, wątek stalkera[/spoiler]

Co jest HOT:
+ przede wszystkim twinpeaksowa atmosfera dziwności;
+ ma się ochotę na więcej.

Co jest NO WIESZ, CO ZALEŻY:
~ kontynuacja dziwnych przygód miała wyjść w 2016, ale na razie ani widu, ani słychu. Za to na forum gry jest fajna dyskusja omawiająca teorie;
~ zagadki w tej przygodówce są banalnie proste - mało przedmiotów, mało dostępnych lokacji. Ewidentnie gejmplej nie miał odciągać od historii.

A co NOT:
- dubbing jest mocno taki se;
- nie można zmusić postaci do szybszego chodzenia;
- momentami natchnione gadki psują nastrój (monolog okienny, wątek Judasza).

"The Charnel House Trilogy" to przygoda z niewielką ilością przygodówki na ok. 2 godziny. Nie polecam fanom zagadek, za to tym, którzy w horrorach szukają przede wszystkim dziwów, gęstej atmosfery i tkaczy teorii.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079183520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1530810678}
review:
I've read that the middle part of this trilogy ("Sepulchre") was originally released as its own story, and that makes a lot of sense. It's really two stories in this game, with the bookend chapters ("Inhale" and "Exhale") telling one while the middle tells another. The main characters of each one do get mentioned in the other, but they don't really have any effect on the plot, such as it is. The two leads feature in stories that are tonally somewhat different as well, which isn't necessarily a bad thing but makes the game feel less cohesive as a single unit.

With that introductory comment, let me just say that it's a fairly basic couple of stories with what I found to be too overt symbolism. It's a point-and-click adventure, but one without much puzzle-solving--there's usually only one path to progression and it's pretty obvious what you need to do. There's no "moon logic," which is good, but neither do the solutions feel like you've accomplished much. There are occasionally decorative things to click on, but when your character says "That's nothing of interest" that feels like a bit of a cop-out by the designers.

It is fully voiced, which is a nice touch, but I found myself reading through the lines and skipping ahead to the next ones pretty much all of the time.

If you want a couple of creepy stories with this kind of symbolism, you can find it better in other places. Given its length and unimpressive narrative, I wouldn't recommend this to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045118691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1533524941}
review:
The story had promise, the voice acting was pretty good, and the artwork has that cool retro feel. The ending had me wanting more, which seems like will never happen since there are no other games in the series.
The background and life stories of the characters was ok, but the vague ending kind of cheated me of enjoying it fully. That being said, still worth a play, but know you're getting into an unfinished story (with no sequel on the horizon).

author: {'steamid': '76561198000145982', 'num_games_owned': 1469, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1516226391}
review:
Важно упомянуть, что всей душой люблю предыдущий проект авторов - Richard and Alice. ♥ 
Проходил его на все концовки не раз, сильно цепляет до глубины души своими диалогами не хуже любого фильма. В игре было прекрасно всё - подача, визуализация, звук и музыка. Немного подкачивал геймплей своей монотонностью, но сильно не надоедал.
----
Честно - Charnel House как будто совсем от других разработчиков. Тут нет вообще никакой глубины и смакования происходящего на экране (не цепляет за душу), диалоги более скудные, геймплей лишь номинально представлен, а продолжительность для т.н. ТРИЛОГИИ вообще смешная - за пару часов неспешного и вдумчивого прохождения можно легко осилить. Знаю, что трилогия лишь условная (повествование делится на три логичных куска), но всё же.

Из плюсов - парочка креативных идей в сюжете, лёгкие достижения и коллеционные карточки. На этом всё.

Реиграбельность нулевая, никакого саспенса, т.е.ожидания развязки нет близко, скорее томительно ожидаешь финала. В общем - намного хуже, чем пять крутых квестов  BlackWell. За 150 рублей, полную цену, брать точно не имеет смысла. Увы, ставлю оценку отрицательную.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999747491', 'num_games_owned': 1568, 'num_reviews': 449, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1527888868}
review:
Das Spiel schafft eine tolle Atmosphäre und hat mich mit seiner Story auch sehr gepackt. Dazu kommen für ein Indiespiel unglaublich gute Synchronsprecher. Es ist kein Horrorspiel im modernen Sinne voller Schockeffekte, aber mit einem guten Grusel-Suspense-Faktor. Ich mag keine Horrorspiele, aber dieses Spiel mochte ich dennoch sehr, denn man ist wirklich gespannt, wohin das alles führt.
Und genau da ist auch die allerallergrösste Schwäche: Das Spiel ist nicht fertig. Ja, es gibt ein paar "Aha" am Ende, aber ganz viele Fäden bleiben offen respektive Fragen ungeklärt. Das ist extrem unbefriedigend, zumal der bereits angekündigte Nachfolger im Moment nicht unmittelbar am Horizont sichtbar ist und unklar ist, ob er jemals veröffentlicht wird. Schade, dass diese Tatsache auch nirgendwo auf der Shopseite wirklich ersichtlich wird.

Fazit: Wer ein packendes Spiel sucht mit einer tollen Atmosphäre darf diesem kurzen, packenden Adventure eine Chance geben, sofern man damit leben kann, dass das Ende sehr unbefriedigend ist und man einfach den Weg dorthin geniesst. Weil dieser Weg sehr toll ist gibt es trotzdem eine Empfehlung.

Sollte der Nachfolger erscheinen und nur ähnlich gut sein (und wirkliche Erklärungen bringen), dann ist Charnel House Trilogy ein geniales Adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044913888', 'num_games_owned': 1071, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1527967653}
review:
[i]Ignore my playtime-- most of that was idling for cards back in the day-- actual playtime was about 2.5h, and I'm slow.[/i]  :p

A nice, short, creepy story with light puzzling and some interesting characters.  The story is broken up into three short chapters (hence the name, y'know?).  Everything is voice acted, which for the most part is excellent-- especially the main protagonist, Alex.  Musical tracks are also nice, ambient, and appropriate.

It's well-categorized as a horror and has some gore and other disturbing elements to it, and plenty of four-letter words.

The price is about right for a short point-and-click, especially if you buy it on a discount or in a bundle.

For achievement hunters, most of the achievements are unmissable/story-related, and most of the others you'll get naturally if you're used to point-and-clicks and like to inspect and try out everything.  If you miss one, you can always go back and replay a given chapter via chapter select.

Anyway, I recommend it-- give it a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198206178121', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1527424758}
review: Хорошая игрушка на пару часов. При покупке я надеялся на квест, но The Charnel House скорее визуальная новелла. Загадок в игре нет, а при продвижении по сюжету персонажи прямым текстом говорят вам куда идти и что делать. Но атмосфера довольно неплохая и, если вы любите мистику, то рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035884174', 'num_games_owned': 804, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1543256243}
review:
A short horror that uses it's point & click elements as a backdrop on which to tell a surprisingly well written, albeit sometimes a bit on the nose, story. Interesting enough to keep your attention all the way through and ambiguous without ever feeling frustrating. There's a good atmosphere throughout the game, especially in the first act. My complaints boil down to there not being enough puzzling and that the story tends to get a bit too silly near the end, as what happends doesn't mesh that well with the overall tone of the game. While a plus that it's even there, the voice acting also has some room for improvement. 

Those looking for a traditional point & click won't miss out on much should they pass on The Charnel House Trilogy, but I'd say it's worth picking up if you're at all intrigued by the story. 

[h1] 5.5/10 [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197966134367', 'num_games_owned': 3557, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1527158716}
review:
The only reason I dislike this is because I thought it was going to be an actual point-n-click adventure. This is not even long enough to be a game, it's more a linear short story in three acts.

It's not a bad little horror story, but calling it a p-n-c adventure just hurts it. Its a walking sim to tell a story. There's no real puzzles here.


And the voice acting's quality fluctuates between characters so it ruins the immersion. Even you-know-who's voice sounds worse quality compared to the main character's.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118120122', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1521416591}
review:
I played Sepulchre a long time ago, and I loved the story though felt it lacking or too short, obviously as it is only part of a trilogy. I loved the story, and the heavy, weird, yet not necessarily scary atmosphere. It's like that feeling you get when you read or watch something bizarre, like a weird SCP or a trippy movie.

I just now played the whole trilogy, and I am happy. I do wish it was wrapped up though. A big door was opened at the end, when a certain someone talked about a certain item. Got the sense that if a lot of a people had a lot of many, a pretty awesome long sequel could be birthed. One filled with weirdness, horror, and either puzzles and running, or puzzles and action. Depends on the design.

It's cheap, nice, and I like the characters. Go for it.

review: DUDE. DUUUUUUUUDE. Right away I had a feeling this was going to be a wild ride and I wasn't mistaken. Do yourself a favor and grab this series up. It's relatively short, took me about 2 hours to play through it, but it was incredible and truly strange and unsettling. I've played a lot of point & click horror and this is up there with the best of them. I want more of an explanation for what the hell was going on, but at the same time that's what makes everything that happened all the more upsetting. Loved it!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198023320177', 'num_games_owned': 1613, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1561920323}
review:
This game is amazingly well written. I totally love Alex's monologue in Inhale (the first part of the trilogy). If you like mystery/creepy stories, this one is a must. I'm no expert in artistic styles, but I'd say it feels kind of gothic.

I warn you it has no puzzles, but I didn't miss them because of how short the game is.

Olivia, if you're reading this, I love your writing style and really really hope Augur Peak comes out later this year.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016989249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1516427806}
review:
Pros :
- Breathtakingly beautiful graphics
- Supreme sound acting and marvelous soundtrack
Cons :
- Puzzles. There is none. Literally none. All you have to do is go where you're pointed at and make five to ten inventory uses throughout all the game
- (this one's subjective) The plot. It begins like a healthy high quality adventure but at some point turns into grim and disgusting mess. Maybe it's just me, though.

Overall, you might probably love it if you like twisted horror stories, but you definitely won't, if you're into good old adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198448047276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1514419064}
review:
While the puzzles are fairly easy, the game is most definitely worth playing anyways. The story is engaging and I needed some time to actually grasp the full force of what is behind it. I'm actually sad that the proposed sequel is not out yet, because I  devoured this game in one go and am now hungry for more of it's story.

Overall, if one is looking for a good story, this is an amazing game. The aesthetics and design are very fitting and lovely, yet the gameplay is too weak, if someone is looking for a longer and/or challeging game. 

Still, as soon as Owl Cave creates a sequel of any sort, I'll eat that up just the same.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033056710', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1514061676}
review:
I honestly didn't like anything about this game. It wasn't scary, it was unnecessarily vulgar, it had technical issues (the game crashed 3x in the 2.5 it took me to complete it and during a lot of the time I played, interacting with objects/people would result in a weird popup but wouldn't show the actual words being said), the "plot" was terrible and confusing. I feel like whoever wrote the game thought they were being very clever and creepy and to that person, I'd offer some advice: please try again.

"Three thrilling, horrifying adventure games in one" -- Thrilling and horrifying this game was not. If you must buy it, you should do so when it's on sale; even the lowly $6 price tag is too high.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128461304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1514061149}
review:
英文字幕，全程语音
全篇以三部曲的形式展开，分别从Alex→Lang→Alex视角进行描述。
几乎没有游戏的部分，全程根据提示就能推进剧情，在剧情和人物设定上都可圈可点，另外在氛围营造方面也十分成功，BGM似乎起了很大作用，一点也不突兀，令人沉浸其中。
总体来讲还算满意，甚至可以说惊喜，如果是想玩游戏，那么这里不推荐，如果想看故事，那就可以试试。

author: {'steamid': '76561197971124571', 'num_games_owned': 487, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1513015357}
review:
A collection of three short, interconnected psychological horror stories. A psychological horror in its original sense - about mental, emotional and psychological state of its characters - so there are no vile deformed scary monsters in here.
First two parts of the trilogy are more grounded, rooted in a sense of loss, parting and abuse, while third part reveals that there are bigger, sinister powers at play.
Final credits scene suggested that sequel to this game might be in development, but by looking at developers' website, which hasn't been updated since 2015, that's, probably, no longer the case. Which is a real shame, this game's more straightforward, more logical approach to its puzzle design is what really contributed to the flow of the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138829235', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1512374651}
review:
I didn't have any illusions about what I was going in for when I got this, and yet it still managed to disappoint me bitterly. Do not be fooled by the hype about this being some grand "trilogy". It is a very short game consisting of three chapters, and the content that is there, is profoundly flawed. The main character is the same snarky chain-smoking liberal woman stereotype that's been done to death in Kathy Rain and the Blackwell series. It is infuriatingly transparent who they're trying to appeal to with this gimmick. The story, what little of it there is to understand, is enormously pretentious and random. It feels like the Shining remade by someone who has no ear for the subtleties of the craft.

Dreadful. Avoid. Likely not worth it even if you get it for free. Two hours of your time is more valuable than sitting through this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198327367911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1511625154}
review:
A nice mix of classic, horror and mystery, with a modern day, point and click, adventure. I really got into this game and finished it in one go. I loved the setting on the old steam train, and the overal atmosphere of this game, is simply brilliant.

Pros - a good story with lots of twists and turns and dark themes, great game controls, works well with mouse or gamepad, interesting characters who are very well voice acted, a classic Victorian horror feel, yet a very modern story.

Cons - Would have liked it to be a bit longer, holding thumbs for a sequel. Limited replayability. Would have liked some concequences for wrong or bad choices.

The 'choker' necklace of the lead heroine and her apartment furnishings, braught back some nice 90's memories, this game will also leave you with some lasting memories, most of them very good. 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198079353157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1508942167}
review:
一边查字典一边玩游戏太痛苦了。
本来我是对有字幕的英文游戏有些信心的，
奈何作者有点hardcore，游戏做的很“随性”，各种法语词和其他语言对话。
尤其是列车员don的那一口法式英语，tmd比所有其他英语是母语的角色说的还快还要吐字不清。
坑爹呢这是！
游戏本身的故事，看得出作者野心不小，只是奈何成本有限，心中有个自己满意的剧本，只能以这种最低成本的独立游戏描绘出自己所想的故事。
其实说实话，虽然故事本身没完结，看起来还是个三部曲，
只需要玩通第一部，就能看出来故事本身依然没有跳出老美最俗的那一套。

author: {'steamid': '76561198043277813', 'num_games_owned': 858, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1509039283}
review:
Mein Fazit des Spiels gibt's unten, falls einem der ausführliche Text hier zu lang sein sollte, und man grob die Stärken und Schwächen des Spiels aufgelistet haben möchte.

[h1]Handlung[/h1]
Die junge Frau Alex Davenport und der Archäologe Dr. Harold Lang begeben sich unabhängig voneinander auf eine Reise mit dem Zug nach Augur Peak Island, jeder mit seinen eigenen Motiven. Doch es stellt sich schnell heraus, dass der Zug nicht das ist, was er zu sein scheint. Seltsame, unerwartete Dinge geschehen auf dieser Reise, und auch den Reisenden wird schnell klar, dass hier etwas ganz und gar nicht stimmt.

Die Handlung bleibt die ganze Zeit über spannend. Dadurch, dass sie schnell vorangeht, und viele schaurige Enthüllungen bereithält, stellt sich nie ein Gefühl der Langeweile ein. Man bekommt nur noch Lust auf mehr. Allerdings bleiben auch viele Dinge ungeklärt, beziehungsweise man muss sie sich selbst zusammenreimen.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
[i]The Charnel House Trilogy[/i] spielt sich wie ein sehr simples Point-and-Click-Adventure. Per Mausklick bewegt man sich an den gewählten Ort. Ein Linksklick auf ein Objekt löst eine Interaktion mit diesem aus, während man bei einem Rechtsklick detailliertere Informationen zu diesem Objekt erhält.

Wer genretypische Rätsel erwartet, über die man sich lange den Kopf zerbrechen muss, bis man die Lösung hat, der liegt falsch. Bei [i]The Charnel House Trilogy[/i] steht eindeutig die Handlung im Vordergrund. Deshalb würde ich es weniger als ein Spiel sehen, sondern eher wie eine interaktive Gruselgeschichte.

[h1]Atmosphäre[/h1]
[i]The Charnel House Trilogy[/i] ist ein sehr atmosphärischer Titel.
Durch die teilweise schon surreale Handlung erweckt das Spiel eine unbequeme und vor allem unvorhersehbare Grundstimmung. Man merkt einfach, dass etwas nicht stimmt. Besonders gelungen finde ich, dass der Grusel eher subtiler Natur ist, anstatt sich wie andere Spiele auf Jumpscares zu verlassen.

Der Soundtrack ist schön anzuhören und wird meiner Meinung nach auch sehr gut eingesetzt, um zum Beispiel spannende Situationen entsprechend in Szene zu setzen, oder durch abruptes Verstummen wie ein Schlag in den Magen zu wirken, wenn einer der Charaktere eine entsetzliche Entdeckung macht.

Die Sprecher der Charaktere liefern eine ausgezeichnete Arbeit ab. Besonders der Charakter Alex wurde sehr glaubhaft und natürlich gesprochen. Doch auch die restlichen Stimmen sind überdurchschnittlich gut.

Mein Tipp: Für ein besonders intensives Spielerlebnis abends spielen, wenn alles still und dunkel ist, und man von nichts abgelenkt wird.

[h1]Schwächen[/h1]
Leider ist das Spiel sehr kurz, und nach ungefähr zwei Stunden ist man durch. An sich ist das erst mal nichts schlechtes. Es ist schön, ein Spiel zu haben, das man an einem Abend durchspielen kann. Aber bei einem Preis von 5,49 € erhofft man sich schon etwas mehr Spielzeit.
 
[h1][u]Fazit / TL;DR[/u][/h1]
Kein Spiel für die breite Masse, setzt [i]The Charnel House Trilogy[/i] eindeutig mehr auf das Erzählen einer Geschichte, statt auf forderndes Gameplay. Durch die schaurige Atmosphäre, die bei zunehmendem Vorankommen immer intensiver wird, was sicher auch an der recht kurzen Spieldauer liegt, bleibt das Spiel spannend bis zum Schluss.

Jedoch empfehle ich zu warten, bis das Spiel im Sale mit einem Rabatt von ~30 % ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055041003', 'num_games_owned': 1360, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1505224869}
review:
Disclaimer: I reviewed Owl Caves other game, Richard & Alice, many years ago and was provided with a review key then. I bought Charnel House Trilogy with my own money though.

A fantastic little game. Devised as a demo to upcomin Augur Peak, CHT manages to be a good game in its own right. The story is twisted and fucked up in a lovely way (read: it's about death, worms, zombies and madness, very pulpy). The art style is Ben Chandler goodness, so if you love any game of Wadjet Eye Games' making, you love Charnel House. I also really love how CHT wears its inspiration on its sleeve, or rather its bookshelf. 
Despite being short, the pacing of this game is amazing. Especially the last episode, Exhale, manages to lead players through changes in the environment as to never have them stand still or search for the way. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105156704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1503356184}
review:
Charnel house is a short point and click horror adventure split into three sections or chapters (playable separately) , there are two playable characters Alex Davenport and Professor Harold Lang, (although two of the three sections you play as Alex).  The puzzles  (few that there are) are pretty easy to figure out, and the games main strength is the characters and story. 

It's not a game with  lots of action or danger, or a game that will make you jump out your seat scared.  Its more of a creepy and disturbing horror, than outright scary, and some of the things that the characters discover on their journey are seriously messed up. 

It would be nice if the game was longer, but then it tells the story it needs to without being rushed at its current length, and longer may have made it too drawn out. If  I have any complaints it's more that there's a little too much hand-holding from the game, you're practically guided to everything you need to do, and that the puzzles are too easy . 

This short "trilogy" is supposed to be a lead in to another game, Augur Peak, which is hinted at in the end, but I've not seen any news or official mention of Augur Peak at all since 2015, so am not sure if the main game this was leading into is still going ahead or not.

I did enjoy this triology anyway, even as is,  so would still recommend it if you are a fan of point and click adventures and more paranormal. ominous type horror, just keep the above points in mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970859560', 'num_games_owned': 5618, 'num_reviews': 358, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1503029744}
review:
First thing to know, despite "Trilogy" in the title, this is basically a demo or introduction to another game project ("Augur Peak") that appears to be dead (as of mid 2017). So do not expect a complete story.

It's an okay adventure puzzler akin to the Gabriel Knight series, The "The Last Door" series, or Ben Croshaw's horror games. Except this is very short, and there isn't much to do except advance the story. The puzzles, what few there are, are bottom tier, and are merely "use inventory item on thing in your way," and very simple and obvious.

The story is intriguing enough, and the atmosphere is suitably creepy. Much like The Last Door, the story is a little too obscure to be satisfying, and obviously, it never moves past the set-up. There's some cosmology here that you only get a taste of.

The voice acting is all over the place, from good, for instance the lead, Madeline Roux, and Abe Goldfarb of course, to...not very good. Looking at you here, Jim Sterling. Not a good casting choice, considering the character. The music is good but over-the-top bombastic. The graphics are great in that Dave Gilbert SCUMM engine way.

Overall, it's worth a quick run through (about 40 minutes) but I can't advise paying money for it, considering how short it is and that it's only the beginning of a story. You can play the 3rd part of the "trilogy,"called "Sepulchre," for free at Owl Cave games' website.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982293787', 'num_games_owned': 2327, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1502255505}
review:
I have some pretty mixed feelings about this game, but overall, I think it's worth a play through if you're into narrative point-and-click adventures. While this game does have some puzzles, they're very minor. Nothing in here is going to stump you for more than a minute or two at most. The story is the point of this game, not the puzzles, and I'm cool with that. The story is in 3 acts. The first act is very short, and doesn't really get interesting until the end of it, which is a decent prelude for the better 2nd act. The 2nd act is the strongest and has some moments that really got under my skin and creeped me out in good ways. The 3rd act was the most disappointing for me. It left some questions unanswered, and answers some otherwise ways that felt a little bland and schlocky. [spoiler]The whole plot about her neighbor being the stalker and his gruesome description of the 'murder in progress' feels really out of place here. It was the supernatural stuff that was intriguing and creeping me out, but then they add that bit which feels like it's from a whole different genre of horror.[/spoiler]  Unfortunately I feel like they made the wrong decisions here. I would have preferred to be left wondering about the fate of some characters and the situation Alex is left in, while I would have preferred to understand the details better that they left vague. [spoiler]Why is Alex prone to asthma attacks, when it's not ever her inhaler she uses. Why did she have foreboding feelings about the trip before hand when she thought she was just going to be visiting a friend. Why do people turn into suitcases? Why does the train have some dead and other 'phantom memory' characters? etc. Was there any deeper connection between Alex and the portrait? These questions, if answered properly, could have added more lore and intrigue to the game, in my opinion.[/spoiler] 

So overall, I enjoyed this game, but would have preferred if it had gone in a different direction ultimately. For $6 it's a worthwhile casual point-and-click to play in the evening with the lights out.
